CatDescriptText: Joseph Pozay, window cleaner, West View and Paul Kilgore, window washer, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think is the number one problem for city officials to solve in the redevelopment program?  Why?"  Mr. Pozay's answer reads: "Housing is the number one problem, I think, because so many people are living so close together.  They have no place to play or in which to live."  Mr. Kilgore's answer reads: "Housing, because of overcrowding, and there should be more emphasis on rubbish collection."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Joseph Pozay wearing light colored button down collared shirt with breast pockets, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Paul Kilgore wearing light colored button down collared shirt with breast pockets and hat, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
